cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 mi east-southeast of Key West, Florida and 165 mi east of Camag√ºey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along or just north of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys, south-central Florida, and eventually the Florida Panhandle/Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and the southwest Florida coast from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef, including Florida Bay; portions of central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern coast of Cuba, central and western Bahamas, Florida Keys, south and central Florida Peninsula, and the northeastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at St. Croix; only typical trade-wind conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at St. Croix from Fred.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall expected; heaviest rain now confined to Cuba, Bahamas, and Florida.
